intro: Triplaris filipensis, commonly known as the Philippine triplaris, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed drupe that contains a single seed. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
